title: The Celestial Toymaker
dialogue_triumphs: Yes, I'm bored. I love to play games, but there's no one to play against… But you will become my perpetual opponent. We shall play endless games together, your brain against mine.
goofs: Peter Stephens makes a hash of ordering Dodo back to the beginning for breaking the rules of the TARDIS hopscotch game.

continuity_notes.name: The Celestial Toymaker
continuity_notes.description: A powerful, evil immortal who kidnaps others to play his 'quite notorious' deadly games. He has been waiting for the Doctor 'for a long time'.
continuity_notes.current_status: Bored with his current world and wants to create another.

continuity_notes.name: Dodo
continuity_notes.current_status: Mentions and sees the death of her mother.

roots: Oliver Twist (Cyril is inspired by the Artful Dodger)
Harpo Marx (Joey's use of a horn to communicate)
links: Steven sees himself on the planet Kembel ('The Daleks' Master Plan')

locations.name: The domain of the Celestial Toymaker
locations.description: A surreal realm controlled by the Celestial Toymaker where deadly games are played

untold_adventures: The Doctor's first meeting with the Toymaker
additional_notes: This episode is Doctor Who's first attempt at surrealism, turning symbols of childhood into a nightmarish prototype of The Crystal Maze.
bottom_line: Doctor Who's first stab at surrealism is an unqualified success, taking the symbols of childhood and turning them into a nightmarish prototype of The Crystal Maze.
